professionalTitle: Senior Software Engineer ‚Äî Cloud, Automation & SaaS Architect

faqTitle: No question too small, no doubt left hanging.

faq.question: What‚Äôs your engagement model?
faq.answer: Scoped projects or retainers. Async-first, demos weekly. No surprises (except pleasant ones).

faq.question: How do you ensure quality?
faq.answer: CI/CD pipelines, automated tests, linting, perf budgets, observability. Basically, quality with receipts.

faq.question: What stacks do you prefer?
faq.answer: TypeScript, React/Next.js, Node, Python, AWS, Postgres, Redis, edge functions. Not married to stacks, just committed to excellence.

faq.question: Do you work solo or with teams?
faq.answer: Both. I play well with others but also know how to score when I‚Äôm the striker.

faq.question: Can you rescue legacy codebases?
faq.answer: Yes. Like Indiana Jones, but instead of whips, I use git rebase.

faq.question: How do you handle deadlines?
faq.answer: With respect, caffeine, and ruthless prioritization.

faq.question: What industries have you worked in?
faq.answer: Fintech, SaaS, e-commerce, healthcare, logistics‚Äîyou name it, I‚Äôve probably scaled it.

faq.question: Do you do architecture or just coding?
faq.answer: Both. Think architect who also isn‚Äôt afraid to grab a hammer.

faq.question: How do you communicate?
faq.answer: Async by default, but always clear. Slack, email, Notion, carrier pigeon if required.

faq.question: What makes you different from other devs?
faq.answer: Global experience, obsession with scalability, and humor sharp enough to cut through legacy spaghetti code.

faq.question: Do you work with startups or enterprises?
faq.answer: Both. From scrappy MVPs to Fortune 500 migrations, I‚Äôve seen‚Äîand fixed‚Äîit all.

faq.question: Can you handle cloud infrastructure?
faq.answer: Absolutely. AWS native. I eat IAM policies for breakfast.

faq.question: What‚Äôs your philosophy on software design?
faq.answer: Build for humans, optimize for scale, keep future developers from hating you.

faq.question: Do you do automation?
faq.answer: Yes. If it can be automated, I‚Äôll automate it. If it can‚Äôt, I‚Äôll try anyway.

faq.question: How do you keep skills sharp?
faq.answer: OSS contributions, side projects, conferences, reading RFCs for fun (don‚Äôt judge).

faq.question: Can you mentor or lead teams?
faq.answer: Yes. I‚Äôve led teams across continents. Think Jedi master, but with code reviews.

faq.question: What‚Äôs your attitude toward bugs?
faq.answer: They‚Äôre just misunderstood features‚Ä¶ until I squash them mercilessly.

faq.question: Do you work async with global teams?
faq.answer: Yes. My calendar is as timezone-friendly as my commits.

faq.question: What‚Äôs your delivery style?
faq.answer: Iterative, transparent, demo-driven. You‚Äôll never wonder ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs happening?‚Äù

faq.question: Why should we hire you?
faq.answer: Because I don‚Äôt just write code‚ÄîI build leverage. And I make it fun along the way.

ossPage.title: Open Source as My Supernova.
ossPage.subtitle: I don‚Äôt just ship code ‚Äî I unleash systems. Brutal, battle-tested, and unapologetically opinionated. Fork it, break it, remix it. These aren‚Äôt playground demos. They‚Äôre living, breathing weapons for builders who dare.
